page.title: 02THE AVON MELKSHAM
page.content: The Avon was established in Melksham in 1885. There are 2292 men & women on the work force. They make 5400 tyres a day for cars, motorbikes, and lorries. They also make golf grips and parts for milking machines. Six lorries come into the Avon in a day to collect tyres. The Avon does not own any lorries. They hire them from the British Road Service. They export 35% of their products. They changed to coal as a fuel to save money. They supply tyres for Rolls Royce, Bentley, Rover and Bristol cars. They forsee that there will be no more money for machinery, and therefore the workforce will drop dramatically.
